text: I don't know how anyone can recommend this.  I have had Amazon Echo for years and it works very well (especially with Amazon's own Smart Plugs, compared to Wemos which are AWFUL).  The Amazon Echo is easy to use and intuitive to speak to, and it talks all the time, even in Brief mode.  It routinely adds, "By the way" after it does something and also asks if it did what I wanted.  It never shuts up.  It also feels the need to tell you "Now connected to MacBook Pro" when you shoot music over to it just a few feet away, even though you've already heard the music playing from it, and it then INTERRUPTS the music to tell you that.  Super annoying on a daily basis.  But absolutely nothing is well thought out in comparison on the Apple HomePod mini.  Even simple things on Echo like adding to a grocery list, reading it off, and then telling it to empty the list is easy on Echo, while a real chore on HomePod mini.  I can tell Siri on my iPhone to play my iTunes playlist named whatever and it starts playing it but not on HomePod Mini.  To do that I have to start it on my phone manually and then use AirPlay to shoot it over to the HomePod Mini.  Everything on the HomePod mini compared to the Amazon Echo is clumsy and challenging and mind boggling difficult in comparison, and is simply unintuitive (the former hallmark of Apple under Steve Jobs was always that it was intuitive).  I also took advantage of Apple Music streaming service for 6 months with this purchase, only to fight with it an entire day and end up deleting it.  Ask it to play something like Somewhere Over the Rainbow by Judy Garland and it refused, giving me some other funky version.  Then ask it to play music by Judy Garland and the very first song was Somewhere Over the Rainbow.  It's just unimaginably bad in every way and so I cancelled Music even though it's free and am returning the HomePod mini after day two.
